New Records: India posted the highest-ever innings score in a T20 World Cup final with 176 runs for the loss of eight wickets
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah bowled two superb overs at the death to haul India to a seven-run win
Heinrich Klaasen produced a magnificent 23-ball half-century with finisher Miller at the other end
Suryakumar Yadav took an outstanding catch on the deep long-off boundary with the first ball of Hardik Pandyaâ€™s over
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and elected to bat first
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after the win
South Africa captain Aiden Markram was gutted after the loss and praised the team's performance in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in Barbados
Others: The match was a tight contest with India winning by seven runs
